definition: copper (chemistry)/see also 紅銅|红铜[hong2 tong2]/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
suncake (small round cake made with flaky pastry and a maltose filling, originally from Taichung, Taiwan)
soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
to get or supply meals for a monthly rate/to board/to cater
jelly snack made by kneading jelly fig seeds 愛玉子|爱玉子[ai4 yu4 zi3] in water and combining with flavorings (popular in Taiwan and Singapore)
katsuobushi or dried bonito flakes (paper-thin shavings of preserved skipjack tuna)
